must_have_skills: Monitoring and troubleshooting of ML systems
System reliability and SLAs (performance, latency, throughput, resource utilization)
Data structures and software design principles
Model lifecycle management and continuous monitoring
jd.notes_for_resume:
- Lead design and deployment of scalable ML infrastructure and microservices for production, highlighting distributed systems work.
- Showcase MLOps pipelines covering training, real-time inference, monitoring, and troubleshooting.
- Quantify reliability outcomes (SLAs, latency, throughput, resource utilization) you owned/improved.
- Emphasize Python expertise; include notable libraries, services, or repos.
- Detail deployments using Docker and Kubernetes for model serving.
- Describe model lifecycle management, continuous monitoring, and incident response/on-call experience.
- Highlight cross-functional leadership, program management of end-to-end initiatives, and mentorship/coaching of engineers.
- Add experience with Java or Go (if applicable), plus SQL/NoSQL and Spark.
- Include LLMs/GenAI experience (fine-tuning, serving, evaluation) if relevant.
- If applicable, note work in digital health/healthcare data and success collaborating remotely across time zones.

profile.headline: SENIOR MACHINE LEARNING ENGINEER | GENERATIVE AI & MLOPS ARCHITECT

experience.title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer & AI Solutions Architect
bullets: Led AI/ML for Medicaid integrity and care-management products across large state programs.
Designed and deployed LLM-powered RAG features on AWS Bedrock to generate fraud, provider risk, and patient risk narratives.
Built agentic AI workflows with LangGraph and Bedrock for multi-step fraud pattern discovery and explanation generation.
Engineered HIPAA-compliant SageMaker and Glue (PySpark) pipelines processing 100M+ claims annually with MLflow tracking.
Operationalized supervised and unsupervised models for pre-pay claim scoring, post-pay audit selection, provider and patient risk scoring.
Integrated risk scores and LLM narratives into SIU, audit, and care-management workflows.
Implemented monitoring for data drift, performance, and bias using SageMaker/MLflow metrics and custom dashboards to meet SLOs.
Collaborated with product, engineering, SIU, and clinical teams to define risk tiers, thresholds, and explainable narratives.
Mentored engineers on GenAI, MLOps, Python best practices, and experiment design; contributed reference architectures.
Designed patient risk scoring with features from claims, utilization, chronic conditions, and SDoH; deployed on SageMaker and fed scores to outreach teams.
Built provider risk scoring engine aggregating anomalies and behavior signals; deployed via Glue/Redshift/S3 and integrated into Program Intelligence and SIU.
Architected Program Intelligence platform combining supervised/unsupervised models, network analysis, and LLM narratives for FWA detection.
Developed unsupervised PCA and KMeans pipelines for AuditStudio post-pay audit selection with Glue PySpark ETL and Redshift/S3 outputs.
Delivered real-time pre-pay FWA scoring (ClaimsSure) via SageMaker/Lambda with explainability artifacts and p95 latency targets under production load.

experience.title: Senior Associate Consultant
bullets: Enhanced Medicaid encounter and Open Health Plus systems for CMS and state reporting compliance.
Improved performance and data quality across large claim volumes.
Developed and tuned PL/SQL procedures, triggers, and views; supported data issue analysis and production releases.

experience.title: Test Engineer
bullets: Led test automation and integration testing for FedEx eDD solutions to reduce manual regression effort.
Built regression suites and test data strategies for high-throughput, multi-system workflows.

experience.title: Programmer
bullets: Supported HealthPAS system and integration testing for a state Medicaid program across claims, eligibility, and provider modules.
Developed utilities and scripts to streamline credentialing and test management; improved system stability and data quality.

education: B.Sc., Mathematics, Physics, Electronics — Nizam College, Hyderabad, India (Sep 2003 - May 2007)
AWS Certified AI Practitioner (AIF-C01) — Amazon Web Services (2025)
Data Science and Machine Learning: Making Data-Driven Decisions — Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) (2022)

tailored.headline: SENIOR MACHINE LEARNING ENGINEER | GENERATIVE AI & MLOPS ARCHITECT
tailored.summary: Senior Machine Learning Engineer with 17+ years delivering scalable ML infrastructure, real-time model serving, and MLOps on AWS. Expert in Python, Docker, Kubernetes/EKS, SageMaker, MLflow, and Spark/PySpark with a track record meeting latency/SLO targets and processing 100M+ records annually. Led cross-functional programs, mentored engineers, and productionized LLM/RAG solutions on Bedrock for Medicaid/Medicare integrity and care-management.

experience.title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer & AI Solutions Architect

bullets.text: Led AI/ML for Medicaid integrity and care-management products across large state programs.
Architected HIPAA-compliant ML infrastructure on AWS—SageMaker and Glue (PySpark)—processing 100M+ claims annually with MLflow experiment tracking.
Built and operated real-time pre-pay FWA scoring via SageMaker endpoints and AWS Lambda, meeting p95 latency targets under production load and producing explainability artifacts.
Implemented CI/CD for ML using GitHub Actions and AWS CodePipeline to automate build/test/deploy for training jobs and inference services with versioned code, data, and models.
Containerized ML workloads with Docker and deployed on SageMaker; leveraged Kubernetes (Amazon EKS) for orchestration where appropriate.
Implemented continuous monitoring for data/feature drift, model performance, and bias using SageMaker/MLflow metrics and custom dashboards to meet agreed SLOs.

Operationalized supervised and unsupervised models for pre-pay claim scoring, post-pay audit selection, provider risk, and patient risk; integrated outputs into SIU, audit, and care-management workflows.
Launched LLM-powered RAG capabilities on AWS Bedrock with LangGraph to generate provider, patient, and fraud narratives, including agentic workflows for multi-step pattern discovery and explanations.
Optimized compute and storage costs and resource utilization by tuning Glue/Spark jobs and selecting appropriate SageMaker instances.
Built provider risk scoring engine aggregating anomalies and behavior signals; deployed via Glue/Redshift/S3 and integrated into Program Intelligence and SIU.
Mentored engineers on GenAI, MLOps, Python best practices, and experiment design; authored reference architectures and led knowledge-sharing sessions.
Enhanced Medicaid encounter and Open Health Plus systems for CMS/state reporting; improved performance and data quality across large claim volumes.
Developed and tuned PL/SQL procedures, triggers, and views; supported data issue analysis and production releases.

education.degree: Data Science and Machine Learning: Making Data-Driven Decisions (certificate)

tailored.resume_text:
NARENDER SURABHI
SENIOR MACHINE LEARNING ENGINEER | GENERATIVE AI & MLOPS ARCHITECT
Okemos, MI, USA

SUMMARY
Senior Machine Learning Engineer with 17+ years delivering scalable ML infrastructure, real-time model serving, and MLOps on AWS. Expert in Python, Docker, Kubernetes/EKS, SageMaker, MLflow, and Spark/PySpark with a track record meeting latency/SLO targets and processing 100M+ records annually. Led cross-functional programs, mentored engineers, and productionized LLM/RAG solutions on Bedrock for Medicaid/Medicare integrity and care-management.

SKILLS
- MLOps & ML Infrastructure: AWS SageMaker; MLflow (tracking/metrics); Model monitoring (SageMaker Clarify, custom dashboards); CI/CD: GitHub Actions, AWS CodePipeline; Model lifecycle management & continuous monitoring
- Model Serving & Orchestration: Real-time inference (SageMaker endpoints, AWS Lambda); Docker; Kubernetes (Amazon EKS); AWS Step Functions; REST APIs
- Data & Distributed Systems: AWS Glue (PySpark), Apache Spark; Amazon Redshift, Amazon S3; SQL; Kafka; High-throughput batch and streaming pipelines
- Programming & ML: Python (Pandas, NumPy, SciPy); Java; scikit-learn, XGBoost, LightGBM; PyTorch, TensorFlow/Keras
- GenAI & LLMs: AWS Bedrock; RAG, Vector search; LangGraph; Agentic workflows

EXPERIENCE
Acentra Health — Senior Machine Learning Engineer & AI Solutions Architect
Okemos, MI | Dec 2016 – Present
- Led AI/ML for Medicaid integrity and care-management products across large state programs.
- Architected HIPAA-compliant ML infrastructure on AWS—SageMaker and Glue (PySpark)—processing 100M+ claims annually with MLflow experiment tracking.
- Built and operated real-time pre-pay FWA scoring via SageMaker endpoints and AWS Lambda, meeting p95 latency targets under production load and producing explainability artifacts.
- Implemented CI/CD for ML using GitHub Actions and AWS CodePipeline to automate build/test/deploy for training jobs and inference services with versioned code, data, and models.
- Containerized ML workloads with Docker and deployed on SageMaker; leveraged Kubernetes (Amazon EKS) for orchestration where appropriate.
- Implemented continuous monitoring for data/feature drift, model performance, and bias using SageMaker/MLflow metrics and custom dashboards to meet agreed SLOs.
- Operationalized supervised and unsupervised models for pre-pay claim scoring, post-pay audit selection, provider risk, and patient risk; integrated outputs into SIU, audit, and care-management workflows.
- Launched LLM-powered RAG capabilities on AWS Bedrock with LangGraph to generate provider, patient, and fraud narratives, including agentic workflows for multi-step pattern discovery and explanations.
- Optimized compute and storage costs and resource utilization by tuning Glue/Spark jobs and selecting appropriate SageMaker instances.
- Built provider risk scoring engine aggregating anomalies and behavior signals; deployed via Glue/Redshift/S3 and integrated into Program Intelligence and SIU.
- Mentored engineers on GenAI, MLOps, Python best practices, and experiment design; authored reference architectures and led knowledge-sharing sessions.

Infosys Limited — Senior Associate Consultant
Los Angeles, CA & Pune, India | Sep 2013 – Dec 2015
- Enhanced Medicaid encounter and Open Health Plus systems for CMS/state reporting; improved performance and data quality across large claim volumes.
- Developed and tuned PL/SQL procedures, triggers, and views; supported data issue analysis and production releases.

EDUCATION
- B.Sc., Mathematics, Physics, Electronics — Nizam College, Hyderabad, India (Sep 2003 – May 2007)
- Data Science and Machine Learning: Making Data-Driven Decisions (certificate) — Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT), 2022

CERTIFICATIONS
- AWS Certified AI Practitioner (AIF-C01) — Amazon Web Services, 2025

issues.message: Microservices architecture experience is not explicitly demonstrated (design/ownership of microservice-based ML services on Kubernetes or similar), which is a JD must-have.
issues.location_hint: Skills: Model Serving & Orchestration; Acentra Health bullets

issues.message: Data structures and software design principles are not stated or evidenced (e.g., algorithmic choices, complexity analysis, design patterns), which the JD requires.
Monitoring is covered, but troubleshooting/incident response and on-call ownership are not described.
Distributed systems expertise is implied (Spark/Glue/Kafka/EKS) but lacks concrete system design details (partitioning, fault tolerance, backpressure, consistency trade-offs).
issues.location_hint: Skills: Data & Distributed Systems; Acentra Health bullets

issues.message: Reliability outcomes reference SLOs and p95 targets, but lack specific metrics (p95/p99 latency, QPS/throughput, availability, utilization, cost savings).

suggestions: Add a dedicated microservices section: outline service decomposition for ML serving, interfaces (REST/gRPC), deployment on EKS, service discovery, retries/circuit breakers, and how you handled versioning and rollouts.

Demonstrate software design depth: cite key data structures/algorithms used, complexity improvements, design patterns (e.g., factory, strategy), SOLID principles, and architectural diagrams or repo links.
Document incident response: on-call participation, incident playbooks, tooling (CloudWatch/Prometheus/Grafana/OpenTelemetry), example incidents resolved, and MTTD/MTTR improvements.
Quantify reliability: include concrete p95/p99 latencies, sustained QPS/throughput, availability SLAs, resource utilization (CPU/mem), autoscaling thresholds, and cost savings percentages.

Detail distributed systems design choices: Kafka partition keys/consumer groups, idempotency/exactly-once strategies, Spark cluster sizes/configs, shuffle/partitioning tuning, backpressure handling, and failure/retry strategies.
Expand model lifecycle specifics: model registry usage (MLflow/SageMaker), approval gates, canary/blue-green deploys, shadow tests, automated rollback criteria, and drift-triggered retraining.
Strengthen Kubernetes details: container resource requests/limits, HPA/VPA policies, readiness/liveness probes, node/pod affinity, and security (IAM roles for service accounts, secrets).

Clarify model serving optimizations: container build strategy (multi-stage, base images), inference optimizations (TorchScript/ONNX/Triton if used), batch vs real-time trade-offs, and cold start mitigation.
If applicable, add NoSQL experience (e.g., DynamoDB, Cassandra, MongoDB) and outline usage patterns and scaling choices.
Provide concrete cross-functional leadership examples: program scope, stakeholders, timelines, and outcomes; quantify team size and mentorship impact.
Include remote, cross-time-zone collaboration highlights and any HIPAA/security compliance controls you implemented (e.g., least-privilege IAM, Secrets Manager, auditing).
Link to select code samples, design docs, or talks (sanitized) to evidence architecture and engineering depth.
